IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: DUI#: 23-093 **Incident recorded by issued body worn camera** ATTACHMENTS: -Copy of the MVA printouts -Copy of the breath test data sheet -Copy of the Advice of Rights (DR-15) -Copy of the Officers Certification and Order of Suspension (DR-15A) -Copy of the Notification to defendant of Result Test for Alcohol Concentration (Form MSP 33) SUSPECT: -Aiko Lucindarose Abido Sex: Female Race: Unknown DOB: 01/04/2000 NARRATIVE: Vehicle in Motion (Phase 1): On September 9, 2023, at 0055 hrs, I, Senior Trooper K. Preston (#6305) was conducting traffic enforcement in the area of Route 36 and Creek Side Drive. I was in my unmarked patrol vehicle (C-5) and just completed a traffic stop on the southbound shoulder of Route 36 when I observed an Orange Ford Fiesta (WV Registration: 43Z304) pass me traveling southbound. I observed the Fiesta activate its right turn signal and enter the shoulder just past the bridge over Georges Creek. The Ford traveled in the shoulder for approximately one mile. I activated my emergency lights to initiate a traffic stop. The shoulder transitioned in to a right turn only lane and the vehicle came to a stop in the lane. Personal Contact (Phase 2): I approached the vehicle on the drivers side and observed the female operator was the sole occupant of the vehicle. I introduced myself and advised the reason for the stop and inquired if she was alright. She advised she was alright and handed me the vehicles registration. She began to retrieve her drivers license and I observed an open twelve ounce can of Miller Lite in the center console. I asked her where she was coming from, and she advised Barton. She handed me her drivers license and I asked if she had anything to drink tonight. She replied no. I then asked about the beer in the center console, and she replied no and slurred her speech to the point I was unable to understand the rest of her reply. I then returned to my patrol vehicle and identified the driver as Aiko Mucindarose Abido by her West Virginia Drivers License. I advised the barrack of Abidos information and that I will be conductingStandardized Field Sobriety Tests. Pre-arrest Screening (Phase 3): STANDARDIZED FIELD SOBRIETY TESTS (SFST): Abido freely and voluntarily agreed to submit to Standardized Field Sobriety Tests. The tests were conducted in the turn lane to the front of Abidos vehicle. It was a clear night and the surface of the pavement was free from debris.Abido was wearing a pink t-shirt, light blue sweatpants, and white/desert camouflage Croc style shoes. Abido advised she had no physical issues that would prevent her from completing the tests.Abido was wearing glasses at the time. Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus Test: Abidos eyes were checked, and her eyes displayed equal tracking and her pupils were equal sizes, but constricted.Abido removed her glasses for the test. After stating she understood the instructions I began the test. -I observed Lack of Smooth Pursuit in both of her eyes. Total Clues: 2/6 After the lack of smooth pursuit portion of the testAbido would attempt to anticipate the movement of the stimulus or just stare forward. After being asked to follow the stimulus with her eyes two time she continued not following the stimulus. I then ended the test without being able to complete the entire test. During the test I detected an odor of alcoholic beverage emanating fromAbidos person. Walk and Turn Test: The test was demonstrated and Abido was asked numerous times if she understood the directions prior to her attempting the tests, and she stated yes. - Abido attempted to begin the test twice prior to being told to begin - Abido missed heel to toe on step 2, 3, 5,6, and 7 of the first set of nine steps - Abido stopped at step 7 of the first set of nine steps. - Abido raised her arms multiple times throughout the test - Abido took 27 steps on the first set of nine steps - Abido turned improperly by turning around without taking a series of small step around the lead foot -Abido missed heel to toe on step 3,4, and 5 of the second set of nine steps -Abidotook 19 steps on the second set of nine steps Total Clues: 6/8 When she completed the test I asked her how many steps she took, and she replied I think over 25. One Leg Stand: The test was demonstrated and Abido was asked numerous times if she understood the directions prior to her attempting the tests, and she stated yes. -Abido raised her left leg -Abido raised her right arm during the 10 to 20 second and 20 to 30 second portion of the test -Abido swayed during the 10 to 20 second and 20 to 30 second portion of the test Total Clues: 2/4 Preliminary Breath Test (PBT): Abido was offered the Preliminary Breath Test and submitted to the test. The test resulted in .18 BrAC. ACTION TAKEN: Due to Abidos driving, and field sobriety testing, I placed her under arrest for driving under the influence at 0107 hrs. I asked Abido if she needed anything from her vehicle and she asked i get her phone. I went to her vehicle and to retrieve her phone. In the process of doing this I discovered an empty can of Miller Lite under her purse on the passenger seat. I transported her to the Cumberland barrack in my patrol vehicle. Abidos vehicle was towed away by Johstons Towing. At the barrack Abido was processed and read her Advice of rights at 0154 hrs. Abido agreed to submit to the intoximeter test and the test resulted in .17 grams of alcohol per 210 liters of breath at 0205 hrs. The intoximeter test was conducted by qualified intoximeter operator Sergeant J. Divelbiss (#4425). I issued Abido all the proper traffic citations and provided her copies of the paperwork. Abido was released from the barrack to a sober driver at 0355 hrs. CHARGES: - TA 21 902 a2 : DRIVING VEHICLE WHILE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL PER SE - TA 21 902 b1 I: DRIVING VEH. WHILE IMPAIRED BY ALCOHOL - TA 21 902 c1 I: DRIVING VEH. WHILE SO FAR IMPAIRED BY ALCO CANNOT DRIVE SAFELY - TA 21 309 d : DRIVER FAILURE TO OBEY DESIGNATED LANE DIRECTIONS - TA 21 901.1 b : NEGLIGENT DRIVING - TA 21 901.1 a : RECKLESS DRIVING - TA 21 201 a1 : DRIVER FAILURE TO OBEY PROPERLY PLACED TRAFFIC CONTROL DEVICE INSTRUCTIONS - TA 21 902 a1 : DRIVING VEHICLE WHILE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL All the above events occurred in Allegany County, Maryland. I request this case be closed by arrest.
